<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The amounts shown in this column represent the value of restricted stock awards granted in 2007 and in prior years, based on the FAS 123R valuation methodology that is used to value
restricted stock awards to all participants. The valuation methodology is in accordance with the same assumptions disclosed in Note 8 to the consolidated financial statements contained in our Annual Report on Form 10-K/A for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2007, with the exception that, in accordance with SEC rules, the valuation shown in the Summary Compensation Table assumes no forfeitures for active named executive officers. Grants awarded in 2007 are presented in the Grants of
Plan Based Awards Table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

of Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s pension benefits decreased from the prior year, and therefore is shown as a zero value. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For reasons of security and personal safety, we require Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld to use our aircraft for all travel. The incremental cost of personal use of our aircraft includes the cost
of trip-related crew hotels and meals, in-flight food and beverages, landing and ground handling fees, hourly maintenance contract costs, hangar or aircraft parking costs, fuel costs based on the average annual cost of fuel per hour flown, and other
smaller variable costs. Fixed costs that would be incurred in any event to operate our aircraft (e.g., aircraft purchase costs, maintenance not related to personal trips, and flight crew salaries) are not included in the incremental cost of
Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s use of our aircraft. Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld is responsible for taxes in connection with her personal use of our aircraft and is not reimbursed for such taxes. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These relocation amounts primarily include the costs of shipping household goods, temporary living fees and associated travel expenses. For Mr.&nbsp;Khosla, the expenses also
include the associated costs with establishing permanent residency in the United States. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We maintain certain trusts that are used to offset amounts otherwise payable by us for vested benefits under non-qualified supplemental retirement plans. The trusts and related
assets are not intended to increase total promised benefits to the participants in these plans. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amounts include reimbursement for taxes associated with Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s and Messrs. McLevish&#146;s and Khosla&#146;s relocation to our headquarters.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These payments or reimbursements are made pursuant to a policy that is designed to facilitate the assignment of employees to positions in other countries by covering taxes over and
above those that employees accepting international assignments would have incurred had they remained in their home countries. Differences in tax periods used by taxing jurisdictions, time lags in tax determinations or in the availability of tax
credits or refunds, or other factors in some instances, create circumstances in which tax equalization payments are recovered by Kraft in a different year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Includes a reimbursement for taxes associated with event-related gifts received at the Kraft Nabisco Championship golf tournament. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This amount represents the prorated value of a special stock option award granted to Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld on May&nbsp;3, 2007, based on the FAS 123R valuation methodology. The
valuation methodology is in accordance with the same assumptions disclosed in Note 8 to the consolidated financial statements contained in our Annual Report on Form 10-K/A for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. This grant is presented in the
2007 Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;McLevish began his employment and was appointed to Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer on October&nbsp;1, 2007. The bonus amount reflects a cash sign-on
bonus pursuant to his offer letter. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(7)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr. Dollive concluded his tenure as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer on October 1, 2007. He remained with Kraft until his retirement effective on March 1, 2008.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(8)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Khosla began his employment on January&nbsp;22, 2007. The bonus amount reflects a cash sign-on bonus pursuant to his offer letter. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(9)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr. Vogelsang served as our Executive Vice President, Global Supply Chain until January 1, 2008. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(10)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For consistency and where applicable, amounts have been converted from Swiss francs to U.S. dollars based on the December&nbsp;31, 2007 currency translation rate of 1 Swiss franc to
U.S. $0.88837. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_40"></A>2007 Kraft Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year-End </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="85%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="38%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="5" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Stock Awards<SUP>(1,2,3)</SUP></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Name</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Number of<BR>Securities<BR>Underlying<BR>Unexercised<BR>Options (#)<BR>Exercisable</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Option<BR>Expiration<BR>Date</B></FONT></TD>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The years of credited service under the Kraft Foods Germany Pension Plan reflect Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s service from his date of hire until he was transferred to Switzerland
under a local Switzerland compensation arrangement. The years of credited service under the Kraft Foods Switzerland Pension Fund reflect Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s service from the date of his transfer to Switzerland as a local paid employee through
September&nbsp;30, 2007. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amount has been converted from euros to U.S. dollars based on the December&nbsp;31, 2007 currency translation rate of 1 euro to U.S. $1.47285. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amount has been converted from Swiss francs to U.S. dollars based on the December&nbsp;31, 2007 currency translation rate of 1 Swiss franc to U.S. $0.88837.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_42a"></A>Retirement Benefits </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Both the qualified and supplemental retirement plans are generally offered to executive officers,
including the named executive officers, and vary by country. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Kraft Foods Global, Inc. Retirement Plan </U></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All eligible full-time and part-time U.S. employees, including named executive officers, are covered automatically in a funded non-contributory, tax-qualified defined
benefit plan offered by Kraft. Benefits under this plan are payable upon retirement in the form of an annuity or a lump sum (if the employee was hired prior to 2004). Normal retirement under this plan is defined as age 65 with five years of vesting
service, at which point participants are eligible to receive an unreduced benefit. Vested participants may elect to receive benefits prior to age 65, but the amount is reduced as benefits are paid over a longer period of time. Participants must have
at least five years of service to become vested. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The formula used to calculate a benefit is equal to the following: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.3% of final average pay up to the Social Security covered compensation amount multiplied by years of service up to 30; plus </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.675% of final average pay in excess of the Social Security covered compensation amount, multiplied by years of service up to 30; plus
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">0.5% of final average pay multiplied by years of service in excess of 30. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Final average pay is defined as the greater of (a) the average of an executive officer&#146;s salary plus annual bonus during the last 60 consecutive months of service before separation and (b) the five highest
consecutive calendar years of salary plus annual bonus out of the last 10 years prior to separation. Social Security covered compensation is an amount equal to the average of the Social Security taxable wage bases for the 35-year period that ends in
the year the participant reaches age 65. The Internal Revenue Service has established certain limits on how much employees may receive from this plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As
of December&nbsp;31, 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Dollive was eligible for early retirement pension benefits under the Kraft Foods Global, Inc. Retirement Plan and Supplemental Benefits Plan I. Eligibility begins at age 55 with at least 10 years of vesting
service. Early retirement benefits are reduced at a rate of 3%&nbsp;per year for each year that a participant elects to retire prior to age 62 with a maximum reduction of 20% at age 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Kraft Foods Global, Inc. Supplemental Benefits Plan I </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Internal Revenue Code limits the amount employees may
receive from the tax-qualified pension plan. Therefore Kraft offers a Supplemental Defined Benefit Pension Plan and several named executive officers participate in this plan. This is an unfunded plan that provides for the difference between what
would have been payable based upon the pension plan formula stated above absent the applicable Internal Revenue Code limits and the amount actually payable from the Kraft Foods Global, Inc. Retirement Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Kraft Foods Global, Inc. Supplemental Benefits Plan II&#151;Ms. Rosenfeld </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s 2006 letter of employment provided her with an enhanced pension benefit that provided for credited service during the period she was not working for Kraft between 2004 and 2006. This enhanced pension benefit was
part of a broader incentive program designed to encourage Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld to return to Kraft. The value of this enhancement at Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s current compensation levels is approximately $667,685. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">52 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>KF Deutschland Versorgungsordnung </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All eligible full-time German employees, including named executive officers, are covered automatically in a funded non-contributory, German tax-qualified defined benefit plan offered by Kraft. Benefits under this plan
are payable upon retirement in the form of an annuity. Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang is grandfathered under the plan and is eligible for normal retirement at age 60. Since this is a frozen pension plan for all participants, all benefits under the plan are
vested. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a frozen pension plan, the benefit to be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang is based on his 1998 base salary and years of service, up to age 60. The
calculation for the annual plan benefit is the sum of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="93%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>

</TABLE></DIV> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Kraft Foods Switzerland Pension Fund </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The normal retirement pension is calculated with current pensionable income and years of service calculated up to age 65. The benefit is reduced for early commencement of retirement from ages 57 to 62. Employee and
employer contributions are 8%. In addition, the employer pays for any additional contributions required over the mandatory 8%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;31,
2007, Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang was eligible for early retirement pension benefits under the Switzerland Pension Fund. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The calculation for the annual plan
benefit is: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">53 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>U.S. Supplemental Defined Contribution Plan </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Because the Internal Revenue Code limits the amount that may be contributed to the tax-qualified defined contribution plan on behalf of an employee, Kraft offers a Supplemental Defined Contribution Plan. All of the
named executive officers, with the exception of Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang, participate in the Supplemental Defined Contribution Plan. This is an unfunded plan that allows eligible employees to defer a portion of their annual compensation (base salary and
annual incentive awards) and receive corresponding Kraft matching amounts to the extent that their contributions to the tax-qualified defined contribution plan (and the corresponding Kraft matching contributions) are limited by Internal Revenue Code
section 401(a)(17) or 415. Executives must defer receipt of the payments until retirement. Executive contributions and employer matching amounts earn the same rate of return as the Interest Income Fund, which is a market rate fund available to
employees in the tax-qualified defined contribution plan. The rate of return under this investment fund in 2007 was 4.7%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Altria Deferred Long-Term
Incentive Plan </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This plan provided participants in the Altria Long-Term Incentive Plan the opportunity to defer receipt of the cash-based Long-Term
Incentive award at the end of each performance cycle. These deferred amounts were and continue to be credited with a fixed rate of return set at the time of deferral. Mr.&nbsp;Dollive is the only named executive officer who participates in the plan.
Mr.&nbsp;Dollive deferred until retirement receipt of his 1995 &#150; 1997 award, which is credited at an annual rate of 6.83%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>General Foods
Management Performance Awards Plan </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This plan was available to General Foods executives. It allowed for the deferrals of annual performance awards.
Deferred amounts are credited with a composite rate that is equal to the average of the interest yield established each year under the U.S. tax-qualified defined contribution plan Interest Income Fund and the rate of prime 90-day commercial paper
issued by industrial corporations. In 2007, the rate of return credited to deferred balances was equal to 4.71%. Mr.&nbsp;Dollive is the only named executive officer who participated in the plan. Upon his retirement, Mr.&nbsp;Dollive can elect to
receive a lump sum payment or receive annual installment payments for a period of up to 15 years. The lump sum payment or annual installment payments will commence in January 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Germany Bonus Deferral Plan </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">German employees can defer up to 100% of their annual bonus, and Kraft will match 10%
of that year&#146;s bonus. This is a frozen plan that does not allow for any current or future deferrals. The amounts previously deferred earn an annual interest rate of 6%, according to an actuarial longevity calculation. However, the present value
of Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s deferred compensation balance decreased in 2007 because: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The discount rate increased from 4.50% in 2006 to 5.25% in 2007; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Legislation increased the earliest age at which a participant may take a social security pension, from 62 years old to 63 years old. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang elected to defer 25% of his 1996 bonus of 178,952 euros. Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang can elect to receive a lump sum payment at age 63 or receive annual
installment payments for a period of up to 10 years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_44"></A>Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change-in-Control </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The tables and narrative below describe the potential payments to
each named executive officer upon termination. In accordance with SEC rules, all information described in this section is presented as if a triggering event occurred on December&nbsp;31, 2007, with the exception of information about
Mr.&nbsp;Dollive. Because he entered into a retirement agreement with Kraft, as described under &#147;Mr. Dollive&#146;s Retirement Agreement,&#148; and concluded his tenure as Chief Financial Officer effective October&nbsp;1, 2007, the following
tables exclude Mr.&nbsp;Dollive. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Involuntary Termination without Cause (Non-Change-in-Control Event) </U></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We generally provide separation pay and benefits to our employees, including the named executive officers, in the event of an involuntary termination without cause.
Kraft has a separation pay plan that provides employees a payment equal to one month of salary for every year of service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the plan, an involuntary
termination without cause is any company-initiated termination for reasons other than: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Continued failure to substantially perform the job duties, other than a failure resulting from incapacity due to disability; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">54 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Gross negligence, dishonesty, or violation of any reasonable company rule or regulation if the violation results in significant damage to Kraft; or
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Engaging in other conduct that adversely reflects on Kraft in any material respect. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These separation benefits are generally structured similarly to those benefits available to all other employees. The separation pay and benefits available to all employees are generally contingent upon Kraft receiving
a general release of claims from the employee. For executive officers, it is typical to use the separation pay and benefits practices in the applicable country as the basis for the pay and benefits. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On a case-by-case basis, we may provide additional pay and benefits to named executive officers in excess of the amount typically payable upon an involuntary termination
without cause. These additional pay and benefits amounts would be compensation for receiving non-competition, non-solicitation, non-disparagement and confidentiality agreements from our named executive officers, in addition to a general release.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The typical elements of separation pay and benefits consist of base salary continuation, health and welfare benefits continuation, and outplacement
assistance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Separation Pay.</I> Separation pay to named executive officers is typically 12 months of base salary, except for the Chief Executive
Officer, who typically receives 24 months of base salary. That amount may be increased, at the discretion of management, with the approval of the Committee, in consideration of the restrictive covenants described above. Separation pay amounts are
typically paid as salary continuation. In some cases, amounts are paid in a lump sum. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event that separation pay is considered deferred
compensation, subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code, payments that would otherwise have been payable are withheld during the six-month period following termination of employment to comply with Section 409A. We then pay the
amount, in a lump sum without interest, as soon as permitted under Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Health and Welfare Benefits Continuation.</I> Named executive
officers typically continue participating in the health and welfare benefits during the period in which they continue to receive a salary. If an executive receives separation pay in a lump sum, then his or her participation in the health and welfare
benefits plans ends at the time of the lump sum payment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Additional Arrangements</I>. In addition to the separation pay and benefits described above,
in accordance with Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s and Messrs. McLevish&#146;s and Khosla&#146;s letters of employment, if any of them is involuntarily terminated without cause prior to the vesting of the restricted stock granted upon (re)joining Kraft,
his or her individual restricted stock awards will continue to vest on the normal vesting dates. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>
<A NAME="toc53662_45"></A>Potential Payout Upon an Involuntary Termination Without Cause at Fiscal Year-End 2007 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the named executive officers active as of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the amounts reflect the following: 24 months of base salary continuation for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld; and 12 months
of base salary continuation for Messrs. McLevish, Khosla and Searer. As a Swiss-referenced employee, Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#146;s separation payment consists of one year of salary and annual bonus at target and will be paid as a lump sum.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amounts reflect the prorated annual cash and long-term incentive plan awards based on business performance ratings of 100% and awards paid at the named executive officer&#146;s
individual target. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The amounts reflect two years of medical, dental and life insurance premiums for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld, and one year of medical, dental and life insurance premiums for Messrs.
McLevish, Khosla and Searer. The amount also includes a retiree medical benefit with a present value of $400,000 for Ms. Rosenfeld and Mr. Searer as they would be eligible for retiree medical benefits at the end of the separation pay period.
Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang does not receive these benefits. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Per the terms of Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s and Messrs. Khosla&#146;s and McLevish&#146;s employment offers, all unvested restricted shares granted to them as sign-on equity awards
will continue to vest on the scheduled vesting dates. The value of the restricted stock award is based on a December&nbsp;31, 2007 closing stock price of $32.63. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects two years of additional pension accrual for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld, and one year of additional pension accrual for Mr. Searer. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amounts have been converted from Swiss francs to U.S. dollars based on the December&nbsp;31, 2007 currency translation rate of 1 Swiss franc to U.S. $0.88837.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(7)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Because Mr. Vogelsang&#146;s payment will be in a lump sum, he will not receive any continued health and welfare benefits, perquisites nor additional years of service for his
additional retirement plan benefits. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Change-in-Control Arrangements </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We adopted the CIC Plan effective April&nbsp;24, 2007. The key elements of the CIC Plan are provided in the table below. In addition, we amended our 2005 Performance Incentive Plan, effective April&nbsp;24, 2007, to
modify the treatment of equity awards upon a change-in-control. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The key elements of the CIC Plan and 2005 Performance Incentive Plan amendments are as
follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Plan Element</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Description</B></FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Definition of Change-in-<BR>Control (&#147;CIC&#148;)</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The occurrence of one of the conditions below:</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Acquisition of 20% or more of our outstanding voting securities;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to certain exceptions, changes to Board membership during any consecutive 24-month
period that results in less than 50% of the current Board members elected to the Board;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our merger or consolidation with another company, and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:6.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;we are not the surviving company; or</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:6.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the other entity owns 50% or more of our outstanding voting securities; or</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Complete liquidation of Kraft or the sale of all or substantially all of our assets.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Double Trigger for Payment of Separation Benefits under CIC Plan</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consummation of a CIC; and</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant is involuntarily terminated for reasons other than for cause or terminates for
good reason.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Definition of &#147;Good Reason&#148;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We take any other action that results in the following:</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Material reduction in the job duties;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A decrease in compensation;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Relocation beyond 50 miles; or</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Increased business travel.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Severance Amounts</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer &#150; Three times base salary plus target
annual incentive;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All other named executive officers &#150; Two times base
salary plus target annual incentive;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional credited years of pension
service and welfare benefits equal, in years, to the severance multiple; and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The foregoing benefits are subject to non-compete and non-solicit restrictive covenants.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Treatment of Cash Incentive Awards</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Awards under the Annual Incentive Plan and the Long-Term Incentive Plan are paid out at target levels, on
a pro-rata basis.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">56 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%"></TD></TR>


<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP> <P STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:45pt"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Plan Element</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Description</B></FONT></P></TD></TR>

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Treatment of Equity Awards</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Restricted stock and stock options only vest upon a CIC if the participant is terminated without
cause or resigns for good reason within two years following such CIC or if the acquiring entity does not assume the awards (&#147;double trigger&#148;).</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Kraft Payment of Excise Tax</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer &#150; we will gross up excise tax payable
due to CIC severance; and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For all other eligible executive officers, we
will gross up excise tax payable due to CIC severance only in the event that the resulting severance benefit equals or exceeds 110% of the Internal Revenue Code Section 4999 limit.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><U>Potential Payout Upon an Involuntary Termination Due to a Change-in-Control at Fiscal Year-End 2007 </U></I>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The table below was prepared as though each of the named executive officers had been terminated involuntarily without cause within a two-year period
following a change-in-control on December&nbsp;31, 2007. The assumptions and valuations are noted in the footnotes to the table. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

executive officers. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amount reflects our cost of providing medical, dental and life insurance premiums for three years for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld, and two years for Messrs. McLevish, Khosla and Searer. The
amount also includes a retiree medical benefit with a present value of $400,000 for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld and Mr.&nbsp;Searer as they would be eligible for medical benefits at the end of the payment period. Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang does not receive these
benefits because he is not covered under the U.S. plans. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

110% of the limit, the actual amount Mr.&nbsp;McLevish would receive may be less.&nbsp;The final amount would be dependent on the value&nbsp;of the non-competition and non-solicitation restrictive covenants. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">57 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><U>Potential Payout Upon Other Types of Separations </U></I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event that a named executive officer is terminated from Kraft due to death, disability or normal retirement, all unvested restricted stock would vest in all
cases. Ms. Rosenfeld&#146;s performance-contingent stock options vest in the event of death or disability. In addition, the named executive officer would become eligible for award payments under the annual cash and long-term incentive plans. Such
award payments would be prorated based on the number of months the named executive officer participated in the applicable plans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Other than the types of
compensation and benefits described in the above tables or as would be received by all other salaried employees, no other payments are earned by or would be awarded to the named executive officers. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on a December&nbsp;31, 2007 termination due to death, disability or normal retirement, the estimated value of such payments for the named executive officers are as
follows: Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#150;$22,943,171; Mr.&nbsp;McLevish&#150;$1,652,389; Mr.&nbsp;Khosla&#150;$2,312,784; Mr.&nbsp;Searer&#150;$5,715,659; and Mr.&nbsp;Vogelsang&#150;$4,603,753. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event a named executive officer separates due to early retirement, he or she could be considered for partial awards under the annual cash, long-term incentive and/or equity programs, at the discretion of the
Committee. The value of the total payments for each named executive officer could range from $0 to an amount no greater than the amounts shown under normal retirement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_60"></A>Mr. Dollive&#146;s Retirement Agreement </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On November&nbsp;19, 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Dollive executed a retirement agreement under
which he agreed to certain restrictive covenants and to additional benefits proposed by the Compensation Committee.&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Dollive retired from his position as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer effective October&nbsp;1,
2007.&nbsp;Under the terms of the Kraft Foods Inc. Incentive Compensation Plan of 2005, Mr.&nbsp;Dollive&#146;s unvested restricted stock awards, which were granted in 2006 and 2007, were forfeited upon his retirement. However, if Mr.&nbsp;Dollive
complies with all of the restrictive covenants in the retirement agreement, the forfeited restricted stock awards will be replaced with the equivalent value of deferred stock units that vest in accordance with the vesting schedule of the forfeited
restricted stock awards. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Dollive&#146;s retirement from Kraft was effective March 1, 2008.&nbsp;At that time, consistent with treatment for other
retirees and at the discretion of the Committee, he received a prorated 2008&nbsp;Annual Incentive Plan&nbsp;and a prorated 2007-2009 Long-Term Incentive payout.&nbsp;The total value of those payments plus the estimated value of the deferred
stock&nbsp;units, based on the December&nbsp;31, 2007&nbsp;closing stock price of $32.63, is $1,693,641. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">58 </FONT></P>

<A NAME="toc53662_47"></A>OWNERSHIP OF EQUITY SECURITIES </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table shows the number of shares of common stock beneficially owned as of
February&nbsp;11, 2008 by each director and named executive officer, as well as the number of shares beneficially owned by all of our directors and executive officers as a group. The table also provides information regarding each individual&#146;s
ownership of specified non-voting interests. None of our common stock owned by these individuals is subject to any pledge. Unless otherwise indicated, each of the named individuals has sole voting and investment power with respect to the shares
shown. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:0%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">maintains a trading price of $38.11 for at least 10 trading days. The remaining one-half of the award will vest only if the stock price maintains a trading
price of $41.43 for at least 10 trading days. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(11)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This group also includes&nbsp;David&nbsp;Brearton, Marc&nbsp;S. Firestone, Karen&nbsp;J. May, Jean&nbsp;E. Spence and Mary&nbsp;E. West. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table displays information about persons we know to be the beneficial owner of 5% or more of our issued and outstanding common stock as of
December&nbsp;31, 2007: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on the Schedule 13G filed jointly by Mr.&nbsp;Buffett and his affiliates on February&nbsp;14, 2008 with the SEC. Mr.&nbsp;Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway share voting and
dispositive power over all reported shares, which include shares beneficially owned by certain subsidiaries of Berkshire Hathaway. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_48"></A>CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND TRANSACTIONS WITH RELATED PERSONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_49"></A>Relationship with Altria Group, Inc. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Prior to our IPO, Kraft was a wholly owned subsidiary of Altria. In the first quarter
of 2007, Altria spun off its remaining interest in Kraft on a pro-rata basis to Altria stockholders in a tax-free transaction. At the close of business on March&nbsp;30, 2007, all Kraft shares owned by Altria were distributed to Altria&#146;s
stockholders, and our separation from Altria was completed (the &#147;Distribution&#148;). Concurrent with the Distribution, Dinyar S.&nbsp;Devitre and Charles R. Wall resigned from the Board. Louis C. Camilleri, the Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer of Altria, continued to serve as a director until he resigned from the Board on December&nbsp;7, 2007. During 2007, we were parties to a number of material agreements with Altria as described below. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;30, 2007, we entered into a Board-approved post-spin transition services agreement with Altria&#146;s subsidiary, Altria Corporate Services, Inc.
(&#147;ALCS&#148;). Under the agreement, ALCS provided information technology services to Kraft. These post-spin services cost Kraft $10 million from April&nbsp;1, 2007 to December&nbsp;31, 2007. Before the Distribution, ALCS provided pre-spin
administrative services to us under a separate corporate services agreement that expired on March&nbsp;30, 2007. Billings for these pre-spin services, which were based on the cost to ALCS to provide such services and a 5% management fee based on
wages and benefits, were $19 million for the quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2007. As of January&nbsp;1, 2008, ALCS no longer provided services to Kraft. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On
March&nbsp;30, 2007, we entered into Board-approved employee matters and tax sharing agreements with Altria. The employee matters agreement sets out each company&#146;s obligations for employee transfers, equity compensation and other employee
benefits-related matters. The tax sharing agreement identifies Altria&#146;s and Kraft&#146;s respective rights, responsibilities and obligations with respect to our income taxes following the Distribution. It also places certain restrictions on us,
including a two-year limit on share repurchases of no more than 20% of our common stock outstanding at the time of the Distribution. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the Distribution,
we had short-term amounts payable to Altria and its affiliates of $449 million, which included $364 million of accrued dividends. We paid these amounts in April 2007. At December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had no amounts payable to Altria and its affiliates
for transition services, and the tax sharing agreement was the only outstanding agreement with any material obligation relating to the Distribution. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_50"></A>Review, Approval and Ratification of Transactions with Related Persons </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under our related person transaction policy,
information about transactions involving related persons is assessed by the Nominating and Governance Committee. Related persons include executive officers, directors, nominees for director, any person who is known to be the beneficial owner of more
than 5% of any class of our voting securities and any immediate family member of any of the foregoing persons. If the determination is made that a related person has a material interest in any transaction with us, the Nominating and Governance
Committee would review, approve or ratify the transaction and the transaction would be disclosed in </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">60 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">accordance with SEC rules. If the related person is a committee member or family member of a committee member, the committee member would not participate in
the discussions of that related person transaction. In general, we are of the view that the following types of transactions with related persons, among others, are not material to investors because they take place under our standard policies and
procedures: the sale or purchase of products or services in the ordinary course of business on an arm&#146;s length basis; any contributions by Kraft that are consistent with our matching gift program or long-standing charitable relationships; or
compensation paid to a director or executive officer for his or her services in that position. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to our policy, no reported transaction qualified
as a related person transaction and therefore no reported transaction was referred to the Board&#146;s Nominating and Governance Committee or other committee of the Board for review. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_51"></A>SECTION 16(a) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our executive
officers, directors and persons who own more than 10% of our common stock to report their ownership of our common stock and changes in that ownership. As a practical matter, our Office of the Corporate Secretary assists our directors and executive
officers by monitoring transactions and completing and filing Section&nbsp;16 reports on their behalf. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We reviewed copies of reports filed pursuant to
Section&nbsp;16(a) of the Exchange Act and written representations from reporting persons that all reportable transactions were reported. Based solely on that review, we believe that during the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, all required
filings were timely made in accordance with the requirements of the Exchange Act, except as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February 2007, David&nbsp;Brearton&#146;s, our Executive Vice President, Operations and Business Services, name was omitted from an internal report of shares
withheld for taxes upon the vesting of restricted stock. Consequently, the related change in Mr.&nbsp;Brearton&#146;s ownership of common stock was not timely reported. Upon discovery of the error, a Form 4 was filed. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2006, Pamela E. King, our Senior Vice President and Controller, sold call-equivalent positions on shares of Altria common stock. Upon exercise, both Altria
common stock and Kraft common stock were transferred out of Ms.&nbsp;King&#146;s account. Upon discovering the error, Ms.&nbsp;King repurchased the equivalent number of Kraft common stock shares and a Form 4 was filed to report both transactions.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In April 2007, due to Kraft&#146;s administrative error, a Form 4 filed on Ms.&nbsp;Schapiro&#146;s behalf underreported her acquisition of phantom shares by 157.9
shares. Upon discovery of the error, the acquisition was reported. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">61 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_52"></A>2009 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We presently anticipate that the 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders will be held on or
about May&nbsp;12, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_53"></A>Shareholder Proposals for the 2009 Annual Meeting </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To be considered for inclusion in next year&#146;s proxy statement,
shareholder proposals must be received by our Corporate Secretary by November&nbsp;25, 2008. In order to be raised directly from the floor during the 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (rather than included in the Proxy Statement), shareholder
proposals must be received by the Corporate Secretary between October&nbsp;26, 2008 and November&nbsp;25, 2008. These notices of proposal must include the information specified in Article I, Section&nbsp;6 of our By-Laws. Send the proposals to our
Corporate Secretary at Kraft Foods Inc., Three Lakes Drive, Northfield, Illinois 60093. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc53662_54"></A>Director Nominations by Shareholders for the 2009 Annual Meeting </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to nominate a candidate for director at the 2009
Annual Meeting, a shareholder must send a written notice, including the nominee&#146;s name and the information specified in Article II, Section&nbsp;4 of our By-Laws to our Corporate Secretary at Kraft Foods Inc., Three Lakes Drive, Northfield,
Illinois 60093. The Corporate Secretary must receive the notice between October&nbsp;26, 2008 and November&nbsp;25, 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
